Posts.Content: Thanks again Diana but what a shame you can't be considered. I've never fly fished in my life or had the urge to but have heard it's so much fun and to meet other's with similar diagnosis would be nice. Thanks for the post though! Tricia
Posts.Title: Free Retreats for Breast Cancer Patients/Survivors

Posts.Content: Thanks Diana, I know quite a few people who have taken part in this weekend and loved it. I've applied myself and may be able to go in September as I'm on the alternate list but of not there's always next year! Tricia
Posts.Title: Free Retreats for Breast Cancer Patients/Survivors

Posts.Content: Hi, I just joined here today and saw your message. I too have extreme bone/joint pain from arimidex, my onc recommended glucosamine/chondroitin which helps a bit and I find exercise also helps. Fatigue is also one of the side effects which I'm sure you know so I hope your ct turns out fine and this all it is. At least you're doing the right thing by having it checked as early detection does make a difference. My friend had bone mets which did travel to her brain but had surgery and rads a year ago and is doing well. My best wishes for benign results. Hope always!
Posts.Title: armidex and hurting!
